notes: The MQB platform is massive. Suspension, brakes, and engine parts interchange freely. Audi S3 aluminum subframes and control arms bolt onto VW Golfs for weight reduction. Golf R brakes fit on standard Golfs and A3s. IS38 Turbo (Golf R/S3) is a direct bolt-on upgrade for IS20 cars (GTI/A3).

The 6-piston Brembo calipers from the Cayenne/Touareg/Q7 (17Z and 18Z) are cheap and massive. With adapter brackets, they can be fitted to VW Golfs, Audi A4s, and many other VAG cars. The 'Touareg' platform itself shares almost everything: doors, glass, chassis, and drivetrains are shared between Cayenne, Touareg, and Q7.

partName: Audi TT Control Arm Upgrade (Lighter/Better Geometry)
notes: Audi TT control arms and spindles are often cast aluminum (lighter) and offer better suspension geometry (roll center correction) than the stamped steel VW Golf versions. Mk1 TT arms fit Mk4 Golfs. Mk2 TT arms fit Mk5/Mk6 Golfs. A popular handling upgrade.

The 'R8 Coil Pack' (Red Top) is a standard upgrade for tuned 1.8T and 2.0T VW/Audi engines. They provide a stronger spark and are more reliable than the stock older revision coils. Often requires a spacer plate for 1.8T engines to sit flush.

Porsche 996/986 4-piston calipers are a very popular upgrade for older VW/Audi platforms. They are relatively small monoblock calipers that fit under many 17" wheels. Requires specific caliper carriers/adapters (widely available aftermarket).

The 6-speed 02M transmission (and later 02Q) is significantly stronger than the 5-speed 02J. It's a common swap for high-power 1.8T builds. Requires 6-speed axles, starter, flywheel/clutch, and shifter box.
